alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 10:16AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Anderson County through 1045 AM CDT... At 1015 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms extending from near Reese to 8 miles west of Maydelle. Movement was southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palestine, Elkhart and Frankston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
